channel.title: Data Analysis I on USP 634 Spring 2018
channel.description: Recent content in Data Analysis I on USP 634 Spring 2018

item.description: Note: The schedule of topics and assignments might be subject to change. Date Lesson Reading Assignment Lecture Lab Overview and Descriptive 04/03 Overview; Stats and Research Design; Data analysis work flow 04/10 Descriptive Statistics; Exploratory Data Analysis Foundation for Inferential Statistics 04/17 Probability and Distributions 04/17 DEADLINE: Init Project proposal 04/24 Foundation for Inferential Statistics 04/24 DEADLINE: HW1 Hypothesis Testing 05/01 Hypothesis Testing for Continuous Variable: t-test 05/08 Hypothesis Testing for Categorical Variable: Chi-squared tests 05/08 DEADLINE: HW2 05/15 Hypothesis Testing: ANOVA 05/15 DEADLINE: Project update Bivariate Analysis and Beyond 05/22 Association and Correlation 05/22 DEADLINE: HW04 05/29 Linear Regression 06/05 DEADLINE: Project Presentation 06/15 DEADLINE: Project Report due

item.title: Policies
item.description: Grading: 3 homework assignments and the class project+paper will make up your entire grade in the course. I use these grading cutoffs: A=90% B=80% C=70% D=60% F<60% Notes If my office hours conflict with your schedule, send me a Google calendar invite for an appointment. Submit in your homework assignments to D2L/Assignments. Extensions on homework due dates will only be granted in exceptional circumstances and only if I am contacted before the due date.

item.title: Tools & Datasets
item.description: Tools R + RStudio R is the statistical programming language we will use in this class. We will interface with R using RStudio, a fully feautred IDE. Installing them on your own computer should be straightforward. If you already have them installed on your computer, I recommend you check the version and upgrade them to the latest version. Ask me for help if you have any problem installing them. Download and install R 3.
